meanings.definition: Make (someone) feel embarrassed, disconcerted, or ashamed.
meanings.sent1: When I tripped in front of everyone, it really abashed me.
meanings.sent2: She was abashed when her mistake was pointed out in front of the whole class.
meanings.sent3: His attempt at dancing abashed his friends, but they couldn't help but laugh.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected question abashed her, leaving her speechless.
meanings.sent5: The spotlight on stage abashed him, making him forget his lines.

meanings.definition: Cause to feel embarrassed, disconcerted, or ashamed.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's scolding abashed the student, making him look down in shame.
meanings.sent2: Being late to the meeting abashed her, as she hated drawing attention to herself.
meanings.sent3: His loud singing in the shower abashed his roommate, who could hear it through the walls.
meanings.sent4: The rejection letter abashed him, making him doubt his abilities.
meanings.sent5: The public speaking event abashed her, causing her to stumble over her words.
